blocks.name: df-ch
blocks.content: Define the set of closed subspaces of a Hilbert space. A closed subspace is one in which the limit of every convergent sequence in the subspace belongs to the subspace. For its membership relation, see ~ isch . From Definition of [Beran] p. 107. Alternate definitions are given by ~ isch2 and ~ isch3 . (Contributed by NM, 17-Aug-1999.) (New usage is discouraged.)

  alcom(s0, s1, wi(wa(wcel(cv(s0), co(c0, cmap, cn)), wbr(cv(s0), chli, cv(s1))), wcel(cv(s1), c0)))

  19.23v(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), co(c0, cmap, cn)), wbr(cv(s0), chli, cv(s1))), wcel(cv(s1), c0))

  vex(s1)
  dfss2(s1, cima(chli, co(c0, cmap, cn)), c0)
  2albidv(s0, s1, wcel(c0, csh), wi(wa(wcel(cv(s0), co(c0, cmap, cn)), wbr(cv(s0), chli, cv(s1))), wcel(cv(s1), c0)), wi(wa(wf(cv(s0), cn, c0), wbr(cv(s0), chli, cv(s1))), wcel(cv(s1), c0)))

thm isch2(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚àà CH ‚Üî(c0 ‚àà SH ‚àß ‚àÄ(s0, ‚àÄ(s1,(((s0 : ‚Ñï ‚Üí c0)‚àß s0[~~>v]s1)‚Üí s1 ‚àà c0)))))
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  bitri(c0 ‚àà CH, (c0 ‚àà SH ‚àß ‚àÄ(s0, ‚àÄ(s1,(((s0 : ‚Ñï ‚Üí c0)‚àß s0[~~>v]s1)‚Üí s1 ‚àà c0)))), (c0 ‚àà SH ‚àß(~~>v "(c0[‚Ü¶]‚Ñï))‚äÜ c0))

  bitri(‚àÄ(s0, ‚àÄ(s1,((s0 ‚àà(c0[‚Ü¶]‚Ñï)‚àß s0[~~>v]s1)‚Üí s1 ‚àà c0))), (~~>v "(c0[‚Ü¶]‚Ñï))‚äÜ c0, ‚àÄ(s1, ‚àÄ(s0,((s0 ‚àà(c0[‚Ü¶]‚Ñï)‚àß s0[~~>v]s1)‚Üí s1 ‚àà c0))))
  alcom(s0, s1, ((s0 ‚àà(c0[‚Ü¶]‚Ñï)‚àß s0[~~>v]s1)‚Üí s1 ‚àà c0))
  bitr4i(‚àÄ(s1, ‚àÄ(s0,((s0 ‚àà(c0[‚Ü¶]‚Ñï)‚àß s0[~~>v]s1)‚Üí s1 ‚àà c0))), (~~>v "(c0[‚Ü¶]‚Ñï))‚äÜ c0, ‚àÄ(s1,(s1 ‚àà(~~>v "(c0[‚Ü¶]‚Ñï))‚Üí s1 ‚àà c0)))
  albii(s1, ‚àÄ(s0,((s0 ‚àà(c0[‚Ü¶]‚Ñï)‚àß s0[~~>v]s1)‚Üí s1 ‚àà c0)), (s1 ‚àà(~~>v "(c0[‚Ü¶]‚Ñï))‚Üí s1 ‚àà c0))
  bitr4i(‚àÄ(s0,((s0 ‚àà(c0[‚Ü¶]‚Ñï)‚àß s0[~~>v]s1)‚Üí s1 ‚àà c0)), (s1 ‚àà(~~>v "(c0[‚Ü¶]‚Ñï))‚Üí s1 ‚àà c0), (‚àÉ(s0,(s0 ‚àà(c0[‚Ü¶]‚Ñï)‚àß s0[~~>v]s1))‚Üí s1 ‚àà c0))
  19.23v(s0, (s0 ‚àà(c0[‚Ü¶]‚Ñï)‚àß s0[~~>v]s1), s1 ‚àà c0)
  imbi1i(s1 ‚àà(~~>v "(c0[‚Ü¶]‚Ñï)), s1 ‚àà c0, ‚àÉ(s0,(s0 ‚àà(c0[‚Ü¶]‚Ñï)‚àß s0[~~>v]s1)))
  elima2(s0, s1, chli, (c0[‚Ü¶]‚Ñï))
  vex(s1)
  dfss2(s1, (~~>v "(c0[‚Ü¶]‚Ñï)), c0)
  2albidv(s0, s1, c0 ‚àà SH, ((s0 ‚àà(c0[‚Ü¶]‚Ñï)‚àß s0[~~>v]s1)‚Üí s1 ‚àà c0), (((s0 : ‚Ñï ‚Üí c0)‚àß s0[~~>v]s1)‚Üí s1 ‚àà c0))
  imbi1d(c0 ‚àà SH, (s0 ‚àà(c0[‚Ü¶]‚Ñï)‚àß s0[~~>v]s1), s1 ‚àà c0, ((s0 : ‚Ñï ‚Üí c0)‚àß s0[~~>v]s1))

  diff.wcel.s(s0, s1, c0)

  diff.chli.s(s0)
  diff.co.s(s0, c0, cmap, cn)
  diff.cmap.s(s0)
  diff.cn.s(s0)
  diff.cima.s(s1, chli, (c0[‚Ü¶]‚Ñï))
  diff.chli.s(s1)
  diff.co.s(s1, c0, cmap, cn)
  diff.cmap.s(s1)
  diff.cn.s(s1)
  diff.wcel.s(s0, c0, csh)

}

blocks.name: chsh
blocks.content: A closed subspace is a subspace. (Contributed by NM, 19-Oct-1999.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 23-Dec-2013.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: chsssh
blocks.content: Closed subspaces are subspaces in a Hilbert space. (Contributed by NM, 29-May-1999.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 23-Dec-2013.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: chex
blocks.content: The set of closed subspaces of a Hilbert space exists (is a set). (Contributed by NM, 23-Oct-1999.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: chshii
blocks.content: A closed subspace is a subspace. (Contributed by NM, 19-Oct-1999.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: ch0
blocks.content: The zero vector belongs to any closed subspace of a Hilbert space. (Contributed by NM, 24-Aug-1999.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: chss

thm chlimi(class c0, class c1, class c2) {

  -| wcel(c2, universe)
} = {
  3impib(wcel(c0, cch), wf(c1, cn, c0), wbr(c1, chli, c2), wcel(c2, c0))
  syl(wcel(c0, cch), wi(wa(wf(c1, cn, c0), wbr(c1, chli, c2)), wcel(c2, c0)), wal(hs0, wal(hs1, wi(wa(wf(cv(hs0), cn, c0), wbr(cv(hs0), chli, cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(hs1), c0)))))
  simprbi(wcel(c0, cch), wal(hs0, wal(hs1, wi(wa(wf(cv(hs0), cn, c0), wbr(cv(hs0), chli, cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(hs1), c0)))), wcel(c0, csh))
  isch2(hs0, hs1, c0)
  pm2.43b(wal(hs0, wal(hs1, wi(wa(wf(cv(hs0), cn, c0), wbr(cv(hs0), chli, cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(hs1), c0)))), wa(wf(c1, cn, c0), wbr(c1, chli, c2)), wcel(c2, c0))
  syl(wa(wf(c1, cn, c0), wbr(c1, chli, c2)), wi(wal(hs0, wal(hs1, wi(wa(wf(cv(hs0), cn, c0), wbr(cv(hs0), chli, cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(hs1), c0)))), wi(wa(wf(c1, cn, c0), wbr(c1, chli, c2)), wcel(c2, c0))), wcel(c1, universe))
  adantr(wf(c1, cn, c0), wbr(c1, chli, c2), wcel(c1, universe))
  mpan2(wf(c1, cn, c0), wcel(c1, universe), wcel(cn, universe))
  nnex()
  fex(c1, cn, c0, universe)
  syl6(wcel(c1, universe), wal(hs0, wal(hs1, wi(wa(wf(cv(hs0), cn, c0), wbr(cv(hs0), chli, cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(hs1), c0)))), wi(wa(wf(c1, cn, c0), wbr(c1, chli, c2)), wcel(c2, c0)), wal(hs1, wi(wa(wf(c1, cn, c0), wbr(c1, chli, cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(hs1), c0))))
  spcgv(hs0, c1, universe, wal(hs1, wi(wa(wf(cv(hs0), cn, c0), wbr(cv(hs0), chli, cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(hs1), c0))), wal(hs1, wi(wa(wf(c1, cn, c0), wbr(c1, chli, cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(hs1), c0))))
  albidv(hs1, wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wi(wa(wf(cv(hs0), cn, c0), wbr(cv(hs0), chli, cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(hs1), c0)), wi(wa(wf(c1, cn, c0), wbr(c1, chli, cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(hs1), c0)))
  imbi1d(wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wa(wf(cv(hs0), cn, c0), wbr(cv(hs0), chli, cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(hs1), c0), wa(wf(c1, cn, c0), wbr(c1, chli, cv(hs1))))
  anbi12d(wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wf(cv(hs0), cn, c0), wbr(cv(hs0), chli, cv(hs1)), wf(c1, cn, c0), wbr(c1, chli, cv(hs1)))
  feq1(cv(hs0), c1, cn, c0)
  breq1(cv(hs0), c1, chli, cv(hs1))
  spcv(hs1, c2, wi(wa(wf(c1, cn, c0), wbr(c1, chli, cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(hs1), c0)), wi(wa(wf(c1, cn, c0), wbr(c1, chli, c2)), wcel(c2, c0)))
  imbi12d(wceq(cv(hs1), c2), wa(wf(c1, cn, c0), wbr(c1, chli, cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(hs1), c0), wa(wf(c1, cn, c0), wbr(c1, chli, c2)), wcel(c2, c0))
  anbi2d(wceq(cv(hs1), c2), wf(c1, cn, c0), wbr(c1, chli, cv(hs1)), wbr(c1, chli, c2))
  breq2(cv(hs1), c2, c1, chli)
  eleq1(cv(hs1), c2, c0)
  diff.hs0.s(hs1)
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs1.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(c1)
  diff.hs0.w(wal(hs1, wi(wa(wf(c1, cn, c0), wbr(c1, chli, cv(hs1))), wcel(cv(hs1), c0))))
  diff.hs1.w(wceq(cv(hs0), c1))
  diff.hs1.c(c2)
  diff.hs1.w(wi(wa(wf(c1, cn, c0), wbr(c1, chli, c2)), wcel(c2, c0)))

blocks.name: hlimeui
blocks.content: The limit of a Hilbert space sequence is unique. (Contributed by NM, 19-Aug-1999.) (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 14-May-2014.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.name: isch3
blocks.content: A Hilbert subspace is closed iff it is complete. A complete subspace is one in which every Cauchy sequence of vectors in the subspace converges to a member of the subspace (Definition of complete subspace in [Beran] p. 96). Remark 3.12 of [Beran] p. 107. (Contributed by NM, 24-Dec-2001.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 14-May-2014.) (New usage is discouraged.)
